response:

Bob is offering me $4000, which is less than my initial 50-50 proposal. If I reject and we go to round 3, any amount I would receive would be worth 20% less due to inflation. So $4000 now is equivalent to $5000 in round 1, and would be equivalent to getting $5000 in round 3.

If I reject, I can make a new offer, but Bob might reject again, pushing us to later rounds where inflation hurts me more. Since Bob faces no inflation penalty, he has a strategic advantage by delaying.

Given these considerations:
